prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole** 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following properties: - Euler Angles: (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) 2. **Construct the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane** of the new coordinate system. This sketch will be the base for our final shape. 3. **Create the first line** with the following properties: - Start Point: (0.0, 0.0) - End Point: (0.0339, 0.0) 4. **Create the second line** with the following properties: - Start Point: (0.0339, 0.0) - End Point: (0.0339, 0.0339) 5. **Create the third line** with the following properties: - Start Point: (0.0339, 0.0339) - End Point: (0.0319, 0.0339) 6. **Create the fourth line** with the following properties: - Start Point: (0.0319, 0.0339) - End Point: (0.0319, 0.002) 7. **Create the fifth line** with the following properties: - Start Point: (0.0319, 0.002) - End Point: (0.0, 0.002) 8. **Create the sixth line** with the following properties: - Start Point: (0.0, 0.002) - End Point: (0.0, 0.0) 9. **Close the loop and create the face.** This face represents one side of the rectangular prism. 10. **Scale the 2D sketch** with a scaling factor of 0.0339. 11. **Transform the 2D sketch into 3D** by setting the euler angles to (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the translation vector to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). 12. **Extrude the 3D sketch** to generate the first part of the final shape. Use an extrusion depth of 0.75 towards the normal, and no extrusion in the opposite direction. This will create a rectangular prism. 13. **Create a cylindrical hole** through the prism. To do this, create a new sketch on the face where the cylindrical hole will be created. 14. **Create a circle** on the new sketch with its center at (0.0179, 0.0169, 0.0) and a radius of 0.002. 15. **Extrude the circle** through the rectangular prism. Use an extrusion depth of 0.75 towards the normal to create the cylindrical hole. The second part of the CAD assembly will be a cylindrical rod that fits into the cylindrical hole of the rectangular prism. The height of the rod will be equal to the depth of the hole in the prism. The radius of the rod will be slightly smaller than the radius of the cylindrical hole. The rod will be constructed using the same steps as the rectangular prism.</description>
